descript.abstract: The Conservation Fund initially coordinated the land trusts mapping efforts. The conservation areas were manually digitized by CGIA. This layer was created with the cooperation of The Clean Water Management Trust Fund. The 2000-2004 updates were coordinated by The Conservation Fund. The 2008 updates were coordinated by Brunswick County GIS Department.
descript.purpose: This data was also created to assist governmental agencies and others in making resource management decisions through use of a Geographic Information System (GIS).
descript.supplinf: >system filename : ltcp file size = 3.91 mb > >Revisions and updates to this layer include: >5.) filename: ltcp0708 The July 28, 2008 update: >Additions of land trust properties provided by Brunswick County GIS Department. >NOTE: Brunswick County gathered shapefiles from each contributing land trust agency. >Attributes are blank in the final data where no data in shapefiles was provided >that matched existing data attributes (and where the land trust website did not >have detailed information to help fill in the gaps). >4.) filename: ltcp304 The March 19, 2004 update: >A) Boundary changes were made to the following land trusts to >match the boundaries from CGIA's Managed Lands data: > BERRYHILL RHODODENDRON BLUFFS (Chapel Hill 24k quad) > BLACK WALNUT BLUFF & BOTTOM (Rural Hall 24k quad) > BOULEVARD LANDS (Southwest Durham 24k quad) > BUFFALO CREEK (Knightdale 24k quad) > CAMERILLE FARMS (Rural Hall 24k quad) > CAPE 2000 CAMPAIGN (Cape Fear 24k quad) > FOSCUE PLANTATION (Pollocksville 24k quad) > GRANDVIEW OVERLOOK (Deep Gap 24k quad) > GREEN RIVER GAME LANDS (Cliffield Mtn and Saluda 24k quads) > HAW RIVER (Bynum 24k quad) > HUMPHREY (Skyland 24k NATURE PRESERVE > CORE CREEK (Fort Barnwell 24k quad) > FOY CREEK (Scotts Hill 24k quad) > NEUSE RIVER/BEASLEY/HOLLAND (LaGrange 24k quad) > NEUSE RIVER/ELEONOR CROOM (Seven Springs 24k quad) > NEUSE RIVER/ELOISE CROOM (Seven Springs 24k quad) > NEUSE RIVER/GREENS THOROUGHFARE ISLAND (Jasper 24k quad) > NEUSE RIVER/MOORING (Kinston 24k quad) > NORTHEAST CAPE FEAR RIVER/HENLINE (Stag Park 24k quad) > OCRACOKE ISLAND/SPRINGERS POINT (Ocracoke 24k quad) > PETTIFORD CREEK (Swansboro 24k quad) > SWIFT CREEK/ANDERSON FARM (Vanceboro 24k quad) > TOWN CREEK/HENRY (Winnabow 24k quad) > TOWN CREEK/TAYLOR TRACT 1 (Winnabow 24k quad) > TOWN CREEK/TAYLOR TRACT 2 (Winnabow and Funston 24k quads) > WASSINK FARM (Elizabeth City 24k quad) >3.) filename: ltcp202 The February 28, 2002 update: >A) LAMPE-WOODARD TRACT added. This affects the Jones Bay and >Vandemere 24k quads. >B) DUNCAN HUNT CLUB TRACT added. This affects the Engelhard West >24k quad. >2.) filename: ltcp501 The May 11, 2001 update: >A) WETHERO MOUNTAIN added. This affects the Bat Cave and Fruitland >24k quads. >B) BOVENDER FARM (EASEMENT) added. This affects the Rutherfordton >North and Shingle Hollow 24k. >C) CARPENTER (EASEMENT) added. This affects the Pea Ridge 24k. >D) VILES PROPERTY (I & II) added. This affects the Reepsville 24k. >E) PAUL AND AGNES RHYNE CONSERVATION PRESERVE added. This affects the Lincolnton East and Lincolnton West 24k quads. >F) RANKINTOWN NATURE PRESERVE added. This affects the Mount Holly 24k. >G) CHARLES WALLACE CONSERVATION EASEMENT added. This affects the >Mount Holly 24k. >H) PHARR YARNS - SPENCER MOUNTAIN WETLAND added. This affects the >Mount Holly 24k. >I) PHARR YARNS - PINHOOK PENINSULA added. This affects the Mount Holly 24k. >J) EASTOVER RIDGE PRESERVE added. This affects the Charlotte East 24k. >K) GAR CREEK - BRANDEMAIER added. This affects the Derita and Mountain >Island Lake 24k quads. >L) JOHN BUNYAN GREEN FARM added. This affects the Stanfield 24k. >M) WESFEL PRESERVE (SMITH EASEMENT) added. This affects the Morrow >Mountain 24k. >N) WHITTED-HESTER TRACT added. This affects the Council 24k. >O) OLD TOWN PLANTATION added. This affects the Wilmington 24k. >P) PLEASANT OAKS PLANTATION added. This affects the Wilmington 24k. >Q) CAPE FEAR ROYAL TRACTS added. This affects the Castle Hayne and >Wilmington 24k quads. >R) CASTLE BAY TRACT added. This affects the Topsail 24k. >S) FIVE EAGLES PARTNERS TRACT added. This affects the Mooretown 24k. >T) EMERSON TRACT added. This affects the Pasquotank 24k. >U) FOSCUE PLANTATION added. This affects the Pollocksville 24k. >V) BELLAIR PLANTATION added. This affects the Greenville Northwest 24k. >W) FRANK PARKER PRESERVE added. This affects the Falkland and >Greenville Northwest 24k quads. >X) BLUE BANKS FARM added. This affects the Greenville Northwest 24k. >Y) VALENTINE FARM (EASEMENT) added. This affects the Bunn East and >Spring Hope 24k quads. >1.) filename: ltcp100 The January 11, 2000 version was the first >released to the database. >Original coverage was generated April 1998. The following updates >were made in January 11, 2000 : >Boundaries for the following Land Trust Conservation Properties were >updated to be coincident with available county parcel digital data or >publicly-owned lands digital data (with GIS ACRES recalculated for each): >Buncombe County: ASHEVILLE WATERSHED >Carteret County: NEWPORT RIVER MARSH PRESERVE >Johnston County: FLOWER HILL NATURE PRESERVE, MIDDLE CREEK, >POPLAR CREEK BLUFFS, SUMMERS FARM >Mitchell County: BAUCOM >Moore County : PAINT HILL EASEMENT >New Hanover County: NORTHCHASE BOTTOMLANDS, TELFAIRS CREEK (BEACH WALK) >Transylvania County: GWEN VALLEY INC >Wake County: BUFFALO CREEK, JOSLIN GARDEN, REID WILDFLOWER GARDEN, >RICHLAND CREEK, SWIFT CREEK BLUFFS NATURAL AREA, TEMPLE FLAT ROCK, >THE ROCKS

place.placekt: William S. Powell, The North Carolina GAZETTEER, A Dictionary of Tar Heel Places, (Chapel Hill: University of North Carolina Press), August 1984.

idinfo.useconst: Acknowledgement of products derived from this data set should cite the following: The source of the Land Trust Conservation Properties data is NC OneMap. Earlier versions of this dataset may exist The user must be sure to use the appropriate data set for the time period of interest. While efforts have been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the state of the art, CGIA cannot assume liability for any damages or misrepresentation caused by any inaccuracies in the data or as a result of changes to the data caused by system transfers.

attracc.attraccr: The Conservation Fund developed this accuracy table. site acreage allowable error between deed acreage and digitized acreage >0 - 10 less than 50% >10 - 100 less than 35% >100 and above less than 25%

dataqual.logic: Using ESRI's ARC/INFO GIS software, the data set was built for arc and polygon topology using the "build" command. The data set was then cleaned with a fuzzy tolerance of (1 meter.) Topology has not been edited since the last build or clean.
dataqual.complete: Five sites were left out of the final coverage because their acreage as digitized was in excess of the allowable error as defined by The Conservation Fund: >Lake Brandt Greenway - Piedmont Land Conservancy >Little Alamance Creek - Piedmont Land Conservancy >Shipyard Landing Preserve - North Carolina Coastal Land Trust >Turkey Creek - Southern Appalachian Highlands Conservancy >Walcott - Pacolet Area Conservancy

horizpa.horizpar: Boundaries were hand-drawn on USGS 1:24,000 scale quadrangles and then manually digitized. Checkplots were created at 1:24,000 scale to ensure accuracy. A spreadsheet database was used to ensure attribute accuracy.

srcinfo.srccontr: Paper maps used to delineate land trust boundaries

procstep.procdesc: For the first rendition of the data in 1998-1999, CGIA manually digitized the paper 1:24,000 USGS quadrangles creating digital files. Processing of these files included: editing linework, edgematching, map-joining, labeling, attributing, running checkplots, submitting questions to The Conservation Fund, correcting discrepancies, and creating metadata.

cntorgp.cntorg: NC Center for Geographic Information and Analysis

procstep.procdesc: 2000, 2002 & 2004 boundary updates and additions were incorporated into the file by CGIA staff from shapefiles provided by The Conservation Fund (gathered by them from each land trust office).

2008 boundary updates and additions were incorporated into the file by CGIA staff from shapefiles provided by Brunswick County GIS Department (gathered by them from each land trust office). NOTE: some shapefiles did not have pertinant attribute information. Attributes for these land trust properties (when the land trust website did not have detailed information to pull from) was left blank.

enttyp.enttypd: Land parcel boundaries for properties acquired by the North Carolina Conservation Trust

attrdomv.udom: Property names vary in length and number of words.
Parcel names vary in length and number of words.

edom.edomv: LAND TRUST FOR CENTRAL NORTH CAROLINA
LAND TRUST FOR THE LITTLE TENNESSEE
NATIONAL COMMITTEE FOR THE NEW RIVER

attr.attrdef: Number of acres (per polygon as calculated using GIS)

attrdomv.udom: Comments vary in length and number of words.

overview.eaover:
Polygons depicting land trust areas. Feature Class has the attributes list in the following table.
>ITEM NAME DESCRIPTION >PNAME Property Name >PARCEL Parcel Name >LTNAME Land Trust Name >DEEDACRES Deed Acreage >GISACRES GIS Acreage >YEAR Year of Acquisition >TYPEACQ Type of Acquisition >COMMENTS Comments section

cntorgp.cntorg: NC Center for Geographic Information and Analysis

distinfo.distliab: NCCGIA is charged with the development and maintenance of NC OneMap and, in cooperation with other mapping organizations, is committed to offering its users accurate, useful, and current information. Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of information, errors and conditions originating from physical sources used to develop this dataset may be reflected in the data supplied. The user must be aware of possible conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, original map scale, collection methodology, currency of data, and other conditions specific to certain data. NCCGIA does not support secondary distribution of this dataset without its current, compliant metadata record. The use of trade names or commercial products does not constitute their endorsement by NCCGIA or North Carolina State Government.

stdorder.fees: None. Download from www.nconemap.com is free of charge.

distinfo.custom: Data can be customized on a cost-recovery basis. Contact dataq@its.nc.gov or 919-754-6580 for more information.
distinfo.techpreq: This data is provided as an ESRI shapefile. Other formats are available on a cost-recovery basis - contact dataq@its.nc.gov or 919-754-6580 for more information. Format compatibility is the user's responsibility.

cntorgp.cntorg: North Carolina Center for Geographic Information and Analysis

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is to accompany the dataset. NCCGIA does not support secondary distribution of this dataset without its current, compliant metadata record. If the dataset described in this metadata record was received from anyone besides NCCGIA, this metadata and the dataset it describes may contain discrepancies.
